comments:
I want to work with files on a remote computer trough sftp. I use the RSE functionality provided with Eclipse for this. 

I'm trying to use Eclipse (either 3.2.2 or the newer 3.3RC4 or the released 3.3) with the PDT and RSE functionality. 

I can succesfully make a connection to a remote host by ssh(sftp) and open the files in the normal text editor. Editing works ok, but i want to use the PDT project features like code assist and project outlines. When i switch to the PDT editor or try to open the files in the php explorer it results in an NullPointerException (see below).

The only reference i found was in the message:
Problem - PDT and Subclipse from 12-5-2007 by Ali B on the eclipse.tools.pdt newsgroup. 

It looks like the PDT doesn't recognize the files opened by the RSE plugin. Does the PDT support the EFS (eclipse file system) which the RSE providers or isn't that support needed to open files trough sftp? Because the normal text editor works, i believe this is a PDT problem.  

If you need any more information, please let me know. 

Steps to reproduce :
1. Open RSE perspective
2. Create new connection
3. Choose ssh only
4. fill in host information (next,next finish)
5. Open PDT perspective
6. Create new PHP project
7. Add a folder to this new project (new -> folder)
   Choose advanced, link to folder in file system
   Choose file system : RSE
   Choose the directory containing the php files 
   Finish
8. Open a php file from this added folder -> Results in NPE



---------------
Eclipse 3.3 I20070608-1718 (and 3.3v20070612)
Remote System Explorer End-User Runtime 2.0.0v20070609
PDT Feature 1.0.0.HEAD-79
Also tried with PDT feature V20070611-79
Windows XP and Vista

This is a WST issue and I opened a bug on it last week.
It seems WST does not handle Null values coming from IResource.getLocation() which occurs when working
with RSE.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 196172 ***
